title: Ashraf Ghani In The Lead In Afghanistan’s Election
teaser: NPR's Sean Carberry joins us from the capital Kabul with an update on the presidential election results and fraud accusations.
contentencoded:
The results of Afghanistan’s June 14th presidential runoff vote are being announced today. Though candidate Abdullah Abdullah accused rival Ashraf Ghani of massive election fraud, results from the Afghan Independent Election Commission put Ghani in the lead. NPR’s Sean Carberry joins Here & Now’s Jeremy Hobson with details.

Guest

  • Sean Carberry, NPR international correspondent based in Kabul. He tweets @frankentele.
